website_summaries.verdict: If you want to make small amounts of wine directly from fruit, this kit is a solid inexpensive choice.
pros: Includes everything you need for making wine – except the fruit
Works with nearly any fruit you would like to use
Kit can make up to 15 gallons of wine
cons: This kit does not allow you to make very much wine at one time

customer_reviews.title: My fruit is wasted and must go in the trash
customer_reviews.text: Put everything together and waited for fermentation. (I've made wine before, so familiar with process). No fermentation. Checked yeast. It was almost a year old. Most yeasts have a shelf life of about 6-8 months. This yeast was already 10 months old. I even tried after 24 hrs with original must to make a yeast starter. I added it and still no fermentation. It's been well over a week now and nothing. My fruit is wasted and must go in the trash. The kit itself is a good starter kit, but I should have known that these kits could possibly sit on a shelf for some time. I will start anew with fresh yeast and new fruit.
customer_reviews.author: Mary's Books

customer_reviews.title: I bought this kit to try some strange wines like banana, tomatoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit to try some strange wines like banana, tomatoes, mead, etc. in small quantities just to try. Since I already make normal grape wine, I had other stuff and this kit is a nice addition, however if this is a start, you should probably buy a hydrometer too. It would be nice also if the tube had a few more inches long, it is very short to go from a table to the floor. But overall I am very happy. Oh and try the banana wine, it is just awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Valadas

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Midwest Homebrewing and Winemaking Supplies and Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised it has everything you need to hit the ground running. I was given a box of ripe Lychee and coulded eat them all so with a little Amazon search this kit showed up. Thanks to Amazon's quick shipping and Midwest Homebrewing and Winemaking Supplies for everything I needed to turn my excess of fruit to alcohol at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is okay, but you will need to buy a hydrometer and a thermometer
customer_reviews.text: The kit works okay for a small batch of wine. It does not include a hydrometer or a thermometer. Since these items are essential for wine making, they should be included in the kit.
customer_reviews.author: Cook@Heart

customer_reviews.title: A Bucket, A Carboy a necessity, but nothing else ???
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kit that stated what was to be included. The date of delivery changed repeatedly, when I finally received my product, what WAS NOT included... tubing, airlock, screw cap and straining bag Sanitizer and campden tablets, Pectic enzyme, acid blend, grape tannin, yeast nutrient, stabilizer, and all-purpose dry yeast, Racking cane and tubing. I tried to contact the seller. However, this proved to be difficult. Was difficult to be able to contact seller to explain missing items. I was forced to purchase the items that were stated to be included separately.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn S Boggs

customer_reviews.title: Good kit for the beginner.
customer_reviews.text: The wine kit had everything you need to start a small batch of wine making. The one gallon glass jug was perfect, the airlock was cracked and poor quality. I decided I liked the rubber bung a lot and purchased more of the same over the hard plastic ones you can buy. I now have all the additives needed for future wine making. I didn’t use all that was included, but now I have a good variety. The instructions were pretty much worthless, so I watched a lot of YouTube videos. Didn’t give good details.
customer_reviews.author: cat

customer_reviews.title: For the price you really can't beat this starter kit.
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised at how much value you get from this kit. For small batches of wine or hard cider this is by far the best small kit I've come across. You not only get yeast, a primary and secondary fermenting vessel and several additives but you get recipes and instructions that even a first time home brewer could fair very well. i would buy this kit again just on the basis that you could use it stand alone for experimental batches of new recipes.
customer_reviews.author: KC jetson

customer_reviews.title: Got this for my husbands new venture
customer_reviews.text: I got this for fathers day last year, and my husband has since learned to make wine. He started with fruit wine, and used this kit to make blueberry wine. He has since made pomegranate, peach, and working on a Riesling. He has found so much joy in making wine. This is a perfect kit for anyone wanting to get started making wine at home.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigues Family

customer_reviews.title: Did not get everything I paid for.
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with all the products advertised. Had to order sanitizer from another company. Everything else looks OK but the aggravation of having to purchase products they should’ve been with the package I bought keeps me from giving this the stars I would like to. Edit: bucket does not seal.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Burden

customer_reviews.title: awesome!
customer_reviews.text: this is an amazing product for the value. great for beginners, and the wine recipe book is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A lot of stuff, too little information.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice kit with a lot of items. It's great if you need a starter kit to start making wine. My biggest issue is that they include a book with a lot wine recipes but it feels like they just copied a bunch of them off the internet and made a book. There is no information on how to use what is included. For a person who wants to make his first wine I would look for another kit.
customer_reviews.author: Gil Rempel

customer_reviews.title: The tubing was not included...in both orders!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this kit. When it arrived I was surprised to find out no tubing was included. So I ordered another one because I was going to make a bulk batch anyway. I was very frustrated because when the second order arrived...there still was no tubing. Hey Midwest, what gives?! Everything else was ok.
customer_reviews.author: Jrod

customer_reviews.title: and it turned out amazing! The step by step instructions were a big ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this, to try my hand at homemade wine. I just finished bottling my first batch, and it turned out amazing! The step by step instructions were a big help, but this isn’t a full kit. You’ll still need a hydrometer and hydrometer beaker (flask).
customer_reviews.author: Singlephaser

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit for Wine Making Beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great kit for beginner wine makers. This kit has all you need to start creating wine. After using this it’s easy to expand with additional items if you continue with more batches of wine and require more items.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gaddy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I loved this kit. It is easy for a beginner to use and it was so much fun. I made several of the recipes, my favorite is a tie between apple wine and dandelion wine! I do not own a hydrometer so I just did without and honestly I made some strong wine with this kit, I'm just not sure how strong.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit but instructions would have been nice.
customer_reviews.text: The kit contained all the items in the description but it didn't come with any instructions on how to use the items included in the kit. This is my first experience with wine making, so I didn't have a clue how to use the racking cane, or whether to use the air lock on just the 1 gallon jar or on both the jar and the plastic jug. Instructions would have helped a lot. Thank goodness for Youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the kit.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely worth the value of this kit. The included recipe book is very easy to follow with several new ideas about wine making I had not previously considered. My one complaint is that the lid of the bucket for primary fermentation is not exactly air tight, so you lose pressure around the rim and not through the airlock which made it a little harder to know when the primary fermentation was done. But otherwise its a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gant

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I strongly recommend that you prepare to do a little research as you will find that there are some steps and other materials you may need. A couple of items were missing in the original shipment but the company quickly responded and sent the items without any further problems. Overall I would recommend the company and product.
customer_reviews.author: ar

customer_reviews.title: Has all ingredients
customer_reviews.text: Great starter kit. Instructions are obviously not written by a person familiar with the English language. However if you YouTube some how to videos you can make it work. Kit has all ingredients you need. 3 batches I made thus far all seem good
customer_reviews.author: hp1506

customer_reviews.title: Buy a good home-wine book first before buying
customer_reviews.text: This kit is not complete - you'll need additional items to make wine. Buy a good home-wine book first before buying.
customer_reviews.author: roses

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need to start
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need to start very easy to understand plus there are many how to videos on YouTube
customer_reviews.author: talina

customer_reviews.title: At age 84 I hope I live long enough to enjoy the effort
customer_reviews.text: Just started my winemaking experiment. At age 84 I hope I live long enough to enjoy the effort. But in the meantime, this kit provides everything a newcomer might expect.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Good Christmas exchange gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas exchange gift and it was a big hit. Have not been able to use yet but it definitely is well made and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the most part. Had to rely more on internet instructions than material that came with kit. Had to purchase additional bucket. Just the right size for my grape harvest. Made 3 bottles of wine.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G

customer_reviews.title: Wine
customer_reviews.text: Could of came with a few more supplies, like a hydrometer and vile, instructions are a bit vague, once I get more supplies I'll give it a shot, can't wait.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good with some head scratching
customer_reviews.text: Has almost everything you need(no hydrometer?) Also no instructions or clear place to find them. Found and used another vendors video. Almost good for a intro kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great start for newbies
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter kit for anyone wanting to experience making their own brew.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Morales

customer_reviews.title: I've made wine and cider and they turned out great
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, come with almost everything you need to make all different kinds of wine, cider and mead.
customer_reviews.author: Beligerus

customer_reviews.title: This was awesome. It is a pretty good hobby
customer_reviews.text: This was awesome. It is a pretty good hobby. The book could have been written much better but Google helped out alot. I made a few different wines so far. I liked the Apple the best which I used the receipt from the book.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Just add juice!
customer_reviews.text: Great kit. Came with a great little booklet with recipes for all sorts of wines including mead. Mine was missing one item. I called the company and then sent it right to me. Mistakes happen but customer service was outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: they need to work on people skills
customer_reviews.text: i dont like the fact the lid on the bucket doesnt seal tight and when i called to try to get a new lid they were very rude ......................i will never purchase another thing from them
customer_reviews.author: james obetz

customer_reviews.title: Has everything you could want
customer_reviews.text: This is ready to go. The book is great and has a ton of recipes. Everything is easy to follow and super affordable. The seller is fantastic too and answered my question as soon as I asked it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Lukey

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: It gives you everything you need except the tools to measure alcohol content. Which is fine for the price. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Reedy

customer_reviews.title: Basic wine kit
customer_reviews.text: Great products just no instructions on how to use them. Very limited information on the internet. Had to purchase an auto siphoner and hydrometer to supplement kit
customer_reviews.author: J Hetzman

customer_reviews.title: All parts in a kit need to be 100% free of defects.
customer_reviews.text: The Airlock was cracked when I recieved the kit. I tried tapping it to see if worked, but it didn't help. I've submitted this before and got no results. I've already ordered and received another, so I don't know how you can fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Dallas Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: Parts missing and poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: To start with the instructions were missing and could not find a way to get them. The quality of the containers was also poor. And a bag of cleaner was opened a little and part of it was lost in the box.
customer_reviews.author: John Reed

customer_reviews.title: ... have lots of fruit on my place and would love to try my hand at making some small batch ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm newer at wine making but have lots of fruit on my place and would love to try my hand at making some small batch fruit wines. This setup will be all I ever need.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Wine making
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but no instructions included with product. Lucky for You Tube
customer_reviews.author: dale

customer_reviews.title: Bucket doesn’t seal down creating an air tight seal...
customer_reviews.text: Works great for beginners I needed something smaller then five gallons but the bucket doesn’t seal good when fermentation begins I fixed this with white thread tape around the edge of the bucket now it’s air tight
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Good starter kit
customer_reviews.text: All in all, decent product at a decent price. I'd recommend for those just starting out.

customer_reviews.title: Fun activity.
customer_reviews.text: Still in the process of fermenting so not sure how the wine will actually turn out, but this was a pretty fun project to do with a friend.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow instructions and many recipes for various spirits and wine both!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use out the box, one must get a hydrometer though sold separately..

customer_reviews.title: The best starter kit.
customer_reviews.text: I love that it's a complete kit with an AWESOME recipe instructions book. I am very pleased. I just wished it included a hydrometer to measure specific gravity. Very Pleased!

customer_reviews.title: Wine Kit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad for Fathers Day. He enjoys making wine and this kit was a great starter kit for him.

customer_reviews.title: A boat without a paddle

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need to make homemade wine. Only missing hydrometer.

customer_reviews.title: Wine making kit
customer_reviews.text: Have used this several years. Has everything you need to start out.

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price !
customer_reviews.text: Hmm pretty sure I used it to make wine, it’s sitting and doing its thing. Only time and then a couple of glasses will tell ! Great product for the price !

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this kit! Haven't had any trouble finding what I need to make basic homemade wine recipes.

customer_reviews.title: No instructions included in the package? This is a ...
customer_reviews.text: No instructions included in the package? This is a beginner kit, you would think they would include instructions of how to set it all up??

customer_reviews.title: Kit not complete
customer_reviews.text: Missing from kit - campden tablets, yeast, and glass bottle cap or stopper.
customer_reviews.author: Londa Lamey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I bought this for my hubby. The price was great. Includes tons of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit
customer_reviews.text: Great starter kit. It would've been perfect if it came with two airlocks, but I'm happy and I got what I purchased and I love it. I already started brewing some dirty swish! haha
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try wine making this year... these kits were the perfect place to start! The only thing I needed was the fruit! Recipe book was a huge bonus too!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good kit to start with
customer_reviews.text: A nice kit for novices. It has all the additives you need and a handy recipe book. I suggest that you purchase a hydrometer, test glass and wine thief as well.
customer_reviews.author: mhaase

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner wine kit
customer_reviews.text: I have made 5 batches of wine and they have all turned out well. I would buy this again. Great way to start wine making hobby.

customer_reviews.title: Interesting recipe book
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter kit. It should have come with instructional information, but I was able to find helpful videos on line.
customer_reviews.author: Keith W.

customer_reviews.title: Wine kit.
customer_reviews.text: Everything came well-packaged and unbroken. The equipment is easy to use and the book is very informational and explains everything well.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent kit for making small batches of wine. The extra chemicals add to the value.
customer_reviews.author: Harebare

customer_reviews.title: wine kit
customer_reviews.text: so glad I bought this, first time making wine, easy to follow instructions, great customer service, they get back to you right away with any questions...first batch Great!
customer_reviews.author: dorothy b.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I could have used some more instructions with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Merrill

customer_reviews.title: You need more materials with this kit
customer_reviews.text: This kit is not all-encompassing. It comes with nothing to test or deal with acidity or S.G. Don't make the same mistake I did by thinking this kit would make it easy to brew wines. You're basically paying for the basic "additives", a bucket, some recipes. and a gallon glass jar. The brewing instructions are even lacking. So, be prepared to do a lot of extra research.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Olsen

customer_reviews.title: however to be a really good kit for a first timer a detailed instruction sheet ...
customer_reviews.text: It's all there, however to be a really good kit for a first timer a detailed instruction sheet would be required.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful purchase
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful. Easy to follow instructions. Great value. Everything included.

customer_reviews.title: Have a lot of fun with this kit
customer_reviews.text: This set up is just right for quick brewing in small batches. Little book that's included gave me a lot of ideas about other fruit I could use to make more exotic wine. Have a lot of fun with this kit.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.. Could be better
customer_reviews.text: The racking cane that came in the kit is a poor fit for the desired use, and assembly of said product is not included.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well. I'm on my second batch ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. I'm on my second batch of blackberry wine. My only suggestion is a list of what's included an how to use them. I still can't figure out what the long plastic bent tube is for.

customer_reviews.title: Wine making kit
customer_reviews.text: As indicated in previous reviews, this kit is not complete. There is another add on kit that this same company sells that will give a you a complete kit. It is a great beginner's kit if you are just getting started in wine making and don't know where to start. It has a bunch of wine recipes that are easy to follow. I would also suggest reading books and doing research on wine making before you start. There is a lot of information available.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Jonas

customer_reviews.title: Good beginners kit.
customer_reviews.text: For a first attempt at wine making this kit proved to be just what I needed. Good instructions.
customer_reviews.author: tr0341

customer_reviews.title: As kit it has pretty much everything one needs to get started I did ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item a month or so ago. did not know much about making wine but this helped me get started. As kit it has pretty much everything one needs to get started I did purchase a few extra items to get me on my way. The items came on time and everything advertised was present in the package. Nothing was damaged or broken. I did go back and order a hydrometer other than that its a basic kit that will get you started you can always add more as you go.

customer_reviews.title: but satisfied that everything needed is included
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet, but satisfied that everything needed is included!

customer_reviews.text: My Wife loves the kit and has made quite a bit of wine that we are are waiting to try.

customer_reviews.text: Excellent product.Helpful instruction booklet. Still working on my first batch but all is going well.

customer_reviews.title: the kit is great, but would be better if it had more ...
customer_reviews.text: the kit is great,but would be better if it had more yeast.

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Kit showed up in great condition, however I have never used this equipment before so I was hoping it came with instructions, it did not. It came with a recipe book but what good are recipes if you don't know how to assemble and operate the equipment
customer_reviews.author: Taylor B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kit for those who only want to make 1 gallon of wine instead of the usual 5 gallons of wine from kits.
customer_reviews.text: Usually make 5 gallon batches. But, would like to try out smaller batches for different types of wines. Wanted to make Dandelion Wine but season is over. BUT! Strawberry picking season is coming up and looking forward to making my first batch of Strawberry Wine. Perfect for people who don't want to make 5 gallons of wine. Already had people asking me for a bottle of Strawberry wine even though I haven't even started yet!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need would recommend buying a acid testing kit and hydrometer

customer_reviews.title: Well packaged and complete kit for many fruits
customer_reviews.text: Great starter kit! Has all the essentials for making small batches. Definitely for those who are interested in trying to make fruit wines - and reasonably priced
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: The wine kit is good for amature wine makers
customer_reviews.text: The wine kit is good for amature wine makers. It provides everything you need to start with. The recipe book has more than enough recipes to get you started. If you buy this kit, I recommend that you purchase a hydrometer because it doesn't come with this kit. Overall I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie MacKay

customer_reviews.title: Nice bottles
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine product. When my package arrived there was a broken bottle in the box. I blame the lousy transportation we have these days. I emailed through Amazon, and to my amazement, I received a reply within an hour saying that they would ship out a replacement. I received the new bottle two days later. Talk about a supplier caring about customers. I will order from this customer again. Bottles are nice and thick. Corks are fine and the corking attachment is also fine. This is an add on from the kit I originally ordered. It is a great kit. It has everything you need to make your own wine.
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great starter kit to get an idea of what you're doing.
customer_reviews.author: tg

customer_reviews.title: Dont blame the kit for your shortcomings.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good beginner kit. Making wine isn't an exact science...it takes trial and error, and unfortunately, if you want to make wine, you're going to have to read something, somewhere. You are not going to be competing with E& J Gallo after buying this kit. The kit could have included a hydrometer for another 5 bucks, but if you want to turn fruit into booze in its rawest form, this will work....until you take the time to learn the craft. I have moved to 5 gallon buckets, and after I READ what the chemicals do, I am working on making wines that I like.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Watson

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I am very happy with my purchase. It is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: RONALD J. BOURQUE

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Kit.!!!
customer_reviews.text: If anyone has wanted to try and make some Mead/Wine this is a great way to get started. Quick kit help get you hooked.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Morris

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Our kit was not only missing the recipe book but was also missing the airlock device. We cannot make our muscadine wine until we are able to find the airlock device. We are not impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Neva Smith

customer_reviews.title: Parts broken
customer_reviews.text: This was broken. Need another one. This kit doesnt have instructions either.
customer_reviews.author: Deana

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Has almost everything you need to get started. Would have gotten 5 stars if hydrometer was enclosed. Have 2 gallons of wine started already. Easy many recipes, did have to google a few things prior to actually making the wine. I'm starting with Concord Grape wine since we already had the grapes. Results won't be available for a while. Worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle fan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much a waste of money. Syphon doesn't work. About got drunk trying to make it work. My husband said it needs a check valve. Talks about SG testing in recipe, but doesn't include a tester. Pretty disapointed. Lots of money for a plastic bucket, glass bottle, yeast and a few other chemicles.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Foxworthy

product_meta.title: 1 Gallon Wine from Fruit Kit
product_meta.description: Color:Multicolor1 Gallon Wine from Fruit Kit Explore the pride and fun of small batch winemaking with our best 1 gallon wine making kit! Everything you need to make fruity, country wine at home is included, except the fruit, which you supply fresh! Create your own vintage using your grocers fruit, canned purees, or your own fresh raspberries, blueberries or whatever fruit you desire. Easy instructions and a recipe book help you begin your quest for the perfect homemade vino. Includes all the equipment, yeast and additives you need to make one gallon of fruit wine. 1-Gallon Wine from Fruit Kit includes: Winemaker Recipe Handbook with 101 One-Gallon Fruit Wine Recipes Includes enough additives to make up to 15 gallons of wine, 2-Gallon Plastic Fermenter with Lid, 1-Gallon Jug, Tubing, 15" Racking Cane, Airlock, and Drilled Screw-Top Cap, Straining Bag, 2 oz. Oxygen Wash, Camp den Tablets, Pectin Enzyme, Potassium Sorbate, Yeast, Yeast Nutrient, Acid Blend and Wine Tannin-Note: Fruit, corker, corks and bottles are not included, Equipment kit to make wine from fruit, Wine making, One gallon wine kit, Country of origin - United States, Manufacturer name - Home Brew Ohio.
feature_bullets: 2 gallon plastic fermentor w/ lid, 1 gallon jug, tubing, airlock, screw cap and straining bag Sanitizer and campden tablets
Pectic enzyme, acid blend, grape tannin, yeast nutrient, stabilizer, and all-purpose dry yeast.
Not included: fruit, corker, corks, and bottles
